context_of_use: This use case allows admins and managers to manage user accounts, configure system settings, and maintain products and inventory within the system.
description: Enables admins and managers to manage user accounts, configure system settings, and maintain products and inventory.
triggering_event: Admin or manager initiates system administration tasks.
preconditions: Admin or manager is logged into the system.
assumptions: Admins and managers have the necessary permissions to perform their tasks.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall permit managers to configure system settings.
The system shall enable admins to create and update products.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the extent of permissions for managers.
main_flow: 1. Admin logs into the system → System verifies credentials and grants access.
2. Admin selects 'Manage User Accounts' → System displays user account management options.
3. Admin manages user accounts → System updates user account information.
4. Manager selects 'Configure System Settings' → System displays configuration options.
5. Manager configures system settings → System saves the new settings.
6. Admin selects 'Manage Products' → System displays product management options.
7. Admin creates or updates products → System updates product information.
8. Admin manages inventory → System updates inventory levels.
